text: The student will investigate and understand that weather conditions and phenomena affect ecosystems and can be predicted. Key ideas include
subject: Science
subs: weather measurements create a record that can be used to make weather predictions;
common and extreme weather events affect ecosystems; and
long term seasonal weather trends determine the climate of a region.

text: The student will investigate and understand that the planets have characteristics and a specific place in the solar system. Key ideas include
subject: Science
subs: planets rotate on their axes and revolve around the sun;
planets have characteristics and a specific order in the solar system; and
the sizes of the sun and planets can be compared to one another.

text: The student will investigate and understand that there are relationships among Earth, the moon, and the sun. Key relationships include
subject: Science
subs: the motions of Earth, the moon, and the sun;
the causes for the four major phases of the moon and the relationship to the tide cycles; and
the relative size, position, age and makeup of Earth, the moon, and the sun.

text: The student will investigate and understand that the ocean environment has characteristics. Key characteristics include
subject: Science
subs: physical properties and movement of ocean water; and
interaction of organisms in the ocean.
